messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest.testIssue284()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
1766 :   public void testIssue284() {
1767 :     CompilerOptions options = createCompilerOptions();
1768 :     options.smartNameRemoval = true;
1769 :     test(options, // error occurred here
1770 :         "var goog = {};" +
1771 :         "goog.inherits = function(x, y) {};" +
1772 :         "var ns = {};" +
1773 :         "/** @constructor */" +
1774 :         "ns.PageSelectionModel = function() {};" +
1775 :         "/** @constructor */" +
1776 :         "ns.PageSelectionModel.FooEvent = function() {};" +
1777 :         "/** @constructor */" +
1778 :         "ns.PageSelectionModel.SelectEvent = function() {};" +
1779 :         "goog.inherits(ns.PageSelectionModel.ChangeEvent," +
1780 :         "    ns.PageSelectionModel.FooEvent);",
1781 :         "");
1782 :   }
```

The passing test with the highest token similarity to the failing test looks like:

 ```105 :   public void testBug2410122() {
106 :     CompilerOptions options = createCompilerOptions();
107 :     options.generateExports = true;
108 :     options.closurePass = true;
109 :     test(options,
110 :          "var goog = {};" +
111 :          "function F() {}" +
112 :          "/** @export */ function G() { goog.base(this); } " +
113 :          "goog.inherits(G, F);",
114 :          "var goog = {};" +
115 :          "function F() {}" +
116 :          "function G() { F.call(this); } " +
117 :          "goog.inherits(G, F); goog.exportSymbol('G', G);");
118 :   }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: INTERNAL COMPILER ERROR.
Please report this problem.
Unexpected variable goog
  Node(NAME goog): i0:1:252
var goog = {};goog.inherits = function(x, y) {};var ns = {};/** @constructor */ns.PageSelectionModel = function() {};/** @constructor */ns.PageSelectionModel.FooEvent = function() {};/** @constructor */ns.PageSelectionModel.SelectEvent = function() {};goog.inherits(ns.PageSelectionModel.ChangeEvent,    ns.PageSelectionModel.FooEvent);
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.Compiler.runCallable(Compiler.java:639)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.Compiler.runInCompilerThread(Compiler.java:584)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:566)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.Compiler.compileModules(Compiler.java:557)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:539)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest.compile(IntegrationTest.java:2046)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest.test(IntegrationTest.java:1960)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest.test(IntegrationTest.java:1951)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest.testIssue284(IntegrationTest.java:1769)
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

The failing test covers the following classes:
- com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest
- com.google.javascript.rhino.jstype

Next, I will retrieve the list of methods covered by failing tests for the `com.google.javascript.jscomp.IntegrationTest` class.
